page.title: 03 THE HAMLET OF BURY GREEN
page.content: Bury Green is an attractive hamlet about a mile west of Bishop's Stortford.It is reached by a narrow road from the A120.The centre of the settlement is a large open space with carefully mown grass,around which houses of different dates are well spaced.Other dwellings are built by the sides of narrow lanes. The oldest house is made from bricks & dates from 1665.It was enlarged in Victorian times.Others are timber framed & plastered.Roofs are made from thatch,tiles & slate.The largest buildings belong to the farms which have many outbuildings.Some old timber barns are in bad condition.There are also modern dutch barns built of concrete & corrugated iron roofs.
